Data: Ngidi to Finch, 2 leg byes angled into the pad, clipped through square leg...actually no bat involved
Ngidi to Finch, 1 run a shorter delivery, pulled out to deep square
Ngidi to Marsh, no run back of a length outside off from round the wicket, left alone
Ngidi to Marsh, 1 run back-cuts down to third man, angled wide of backward point, to bring up the fifty stand
Ngidi to Finch, 1 run another short ball and that's a powerful front-foot pull through midwicket
Ngidi to Marsh, 1 run round the wicket, back of a length, gets inside the line and tucks into midwicket
Rabada to Marsh, 1 run full at off stump, blocked on the front foot and a sharp single is stolen into midwicket
Rabada to Finch, no run nips of shape back in on a good length, defended to the off side
Rabada to Finch, 1 run shorter outside off, opens the face and seers down to third man
Rabada to Marsh, no run tight to off stump, dropped down by his feet into the off side...looked for the single but it's not on

Rabada to Marsh, OUT big edge, caught behind! Just as it as looking good for Australia, Marsh goes for a drive on the up, the delivery was back of a length, and gets a thick top edge. Hint of movement off the seam as well
Rabada to Lynn, no run goes for the yorker first ball! Not far away, Lynn just gets it on the full and jabs off the toe end
Steyn to Finch, no run full and straight, Finch misses as he flicks across the line but the ball is angling down leg
Steyn to Finch, no run big appeal for lbw from de Kock, Steyn not that interested, as Finch is again working across the line. The ball didn't straighten a little, but missing leg
Steyn to Finch, no run on off stump, defended square towards point
Steyn to Finch, 1 run steered down to third man
Steyn to Lynn, no run back of a length outside off, driven back to the bowler
Steyn to Lynn, no run good delivery, full at off stump, hint of swing and defended to mid-off
Rabada to Finch, 1 run short outside off, dabbed into backward point
Rabada to Lynn, 2 runs fuller outside off, nicely onto the front foot and drives between cover and mid-off
Rabada to Lynn, 2 runs and again, very similar shot through the same spot, between cover and mid-off. Was in the air for a little while
Rabada to Lynn, no run back of a length outside off, left alone
Rabada to Lynn, no run straighter delivery, back of a length, worked into the leg side
Rabada to Lynn, no run back of a length on off stump, defended back down the pitch
Pretorius to Finch, no run starts with a wide delivery outside off, chopped off the bottom edge towards point

Pretorius to Finch, no run huge appeal for lbw and they go for the review...South Africa convinced this is pad first. Good length outside off stump, nips back, and certainly pad first. Around the knee roll. This is close. Umpire's call on impact, by a millimetre or two. He's lucky
Pretorius to Finch, FOUR runs terrific response from Finch as he drills a full delivery straight down the ground
Pretorius to Finch, 1 run full and straight, plays across his front pad and works out to deep midwicket
Pretorius to Lynn, no run full at the stumps, pushed to mid-off
Pretorius to Lynn, no run good length, defended to the bowler
Rabada to Finch, 2 runs tries for the yorker, becomes a low full toss, clipped through midwicket
Rabada to Finch, no run full outside off, gets forward and pushes to the covers
Rabada to Finch, no run a bouncer, 142kph, and he ducks
Rabada to Finch, 1 run short of a length outside off, opens the face and guides it wide of gully to third man
Rabada to Lynn, 3 runs good shot, gets forward and punches a full delivery from outside off straight of mid-on
Rabada to Finch, no run that's loose outside off, trying to dab down to third man and he's beaten
Pretorius to Lynn, no run length ball at off stump, defended
Pretorius to Lynn, no run medium pace, 125kph, at the stumps and defended to mid-on
Pretorius to Lynn, no run fuller, driven firmly back to the bowler
Pretorius to Lynn, 2 runs a short ball, plays a whippy pull through midwicket, not to far from the fielder
Pretorius to Lynn, no run back on a full length, pushed back down the pitch
Pretorius to Lynn, no run short outside off, left alone
Tahir to Finch, no run full and straight, tapped into midwicket
Tahir to Finch, no run an appeal for lbw from Tahir, but Finch had come a long way down the pitch...didn't read the googly, though
Tahir to Finch, no run driven into the off side
Tahir to Finch, no run a fuller delivery, skids on, defended
Tahir to Finch, no run touch shorter, driven off the back foot to cover
Tahir to Finch, no run flicks across the front pad and works into midwicket. Tahir starts with a maiden
Pretorius to Lynn, SIX runs there's Chris Lynn! Into the stands over wide mid-on. Stand and deliver, clobbers a length ball, a cutter, miles over long-on
Pretorius to Lynn, no run short of a length, hits the pitch a bit harder, played into the on side
Pretorius to Lynn, no run back of a length at off stump, 122kph, punched to mid-off
Pretorius to Lynn, no run fuller, at the stumps, 126kph and pushed to mid-off
Pretorius to Lynn, 1 run fuller and pushed down the ground
Pretorius to Finch, 1 run angles the face and runs it down to third man
Tahir to Finch, 1 run uses his feet and makes it into a low full toss which he clips to long-on
Tahir to Lynn, no run defended on the front foot to cover
Tahir to Lynn, 1 run touch shorter, stays in his crease and drives to long-off
Tahir to Finch, 1 run a little slower through the air this time, Finch waits then opens the face towards short third man
Tahir to Lynn, no run a googly outside off, defended to the covers
Tahir to Lynn, no run full and straight, another googly, defended to the leg side
Pretorius to Finch, no run a slower ball, full at off stump, defended

Pretorius to Finch, OUT dragged on, big strike. Too close for the shot, perhaps? Back of a length outside off, looking to angle it into the off side, takes a bottom edge into off stump. A bit of a cutter, too, so credit to Pretorius
Pretorius to Carey, no run round the wicket to the left hander, defended to cover
Pretorius to Carey, no run gets across to off stump and works into midwicket, wants the single but is rightly sent back
Pretorius to Carey, no run tight to off stump, good length, defended to backward point
Pretorius to Carey, 1 run short of a length, opens the face and angles into backward point to get off the mark
Tahir to Carey, no run very full, clipped into midwicket
Tahir to Carey, no run defended to the off side
Tahir to Carey, no run good length at off stump, forward and pushes to the covers
Tahir to Carey, 1 run there's his first sweep, takes it from off stump out to deep square leg
Tahir to Lynn, no run full outside off, driven to cover
Tahir to Lynn, 2 runs touch shorter, on the back foot, driven past cover and long-off can't prevent the second
Pretorius to Carey, 1 run short outside off, guided to third man
Pretorius to Lynn, no run back of a length, straight at 110kph, punched back to the bvowler
Pretorius to Lynn, no run a sweetly-struck straight drive gets him nothing as it cannons into Pretorius' boot
Pretorius to Lynn, 1 run full at middle and leg, this time he gets it straight down the ground
Pretorius to Carey, no run good length outside off stump, defended to point
Pretorius to Carey, no run fuller, angled into middle and leg, clips off the pad and bobbles down the leg side to de Kock
Tahir to Lynn, no run full at middle, defended
Tahir to Lynn, 1 run tossed up fuller, driven down to long-off
Tahir to Carey, no run knocked away from off stump into midwicket
Tahir to Carey, no run takes a thickish inside edge into the leg side as he gets forward
Tahir to Carey, 2 runs swept away from leg stump, scoots past short fine leg off the bottom edge
Tahir to Carey, no run full outside off, driven to mid-off inside the circle
Pretorius to Lynn, 1 run good length outside off, punchy drive to deep cover
Pretorius to Carey, no run very full outside off, picks out cover as he drives
Pretorius to Carey, 1 run full and straight, tucked through midwicket as he closes the face

Pretorius to Lynn, 2 runs very high, and has the legs to clear mid-off...Lynn aiming a huge shot down the ground, was a slower ball, got more height than distance but landed well clear of the fielder running back

Pretorius to Lynn, 1 run and now a tight run! Traps this off the inside edge down by his feet, called through for the run and a direct hit would have been tight but the throw hit Lynn (who didn't change direction, so is perfectly okay)
Pretorius to Carey, no run not far from chopping this on as he tries to angle down to third man, got cramped for room
Tahir to Lynn, no run defended on the front foot into midwicket
Tahir to Lynn, no run shorter, punched back to the bowler
Tahir to Lynn, 1 run tossed up fuller, driven down to long-off
Tahir to Carey, FOUR runs that's a lovely shot, inside out over extra cover, a late turn of the face to create the placement and terrific timing
Tahir to Carey, no run
Tahir to Carey, no run goes for the sweep, it's outside off, Carey misses and gets taken on the back leg well outside off
Rabada to Lynn, SIX runs dismissive from Lynn! Fantastic shot. A good length ball outside off, Lynn stays on leg stump, throws his hands through a lofted drive which skims over the rope
Rabada to Lynn, FOUR runs well, well, Lynn is taking it on here, this is a bit more of a heave, takes a back-of-length ball and clubs it straight of mid-on
Rabada to Lynn, FOUR runs and now square of the wicket, Rabada went a touch shorter outside off, Lynn cuts it with real power through point. Fantastic batting
Rabada to Lynn, FOUR runs short and hammered away, this is thrilling stuff from Lynn, a predictable short ball from Rabada and he crunches it through straight midwicket

Rabada to Lynn, OUT caught behind, and is that a bit of a send-off from Rabada?! What action in this over. Another bouncer, shorter this time, angling over leg stump, Lynn went for the hook and it takes a glove. Perhaps a word from Rabada to Lynn. Good take from de Kock.
Rabada to Maxwell, no run that's sharp, a bouncer at 141kph for Maxwell's first ball and he has to be quick to get underneath it
Tahir to Carey, 2 runs full outside off, driven through the covers and placed nicely for a brace
Tahir to Carey, 1 run swept from outside off to deep square
Tahir to Maxwell, 1 run full at the stumps, driven back down the pitch and Tahir will be annoyed he couldn't stop that
Tahir to Carey, no run gets forward and drives neatly to short cover
Tahir to Carey, 1 run pushed square through point
Tahir to Maxwell, no run plays back to a quicker ball, pushed to the off side
Rabada to Carey, no run good length, angled across outside off, left alone
Rabada to Carey, 1 run opens the face angles a length delivery to third man
Rabada to Maxwell, no run full and straight, clipped firmly to mid-on
Rabada to Maxwell, 1 leg bye back of a length, takes an inside edge off the pad behind square on the leg side
Rabada to Carey, 2 runs worked off the pads behind square down to long leg...and there's a fumble to allow a second
Rabada to Carey, no run full outside off, left alone
Tahir to Maxwell, no run full and straight, defended
Tahir to Maxwell, 1 run an appeal for lbw as Maxwell plays the reverse sweep, the ball scuttles past the keeper
Tahir to Carey, no run works a full delivery into midwicket
Tahir to Carey, FOUR runs that's a wonderful stroke, down the wicket and lofted over long-off, he was in complete control of that shot. Delightful
Tahir to Carey, no run quicker delivery, defended to cover
Tahir to Carey, no run defended to the off side
Ngidi to Maxwell, 1 run full at off stump, pushed to deep cover
Ngidi to Carey, 1 run round the wicket, full outside off, defended into midwicket
Ngidi to Maxwell, 1 run short outside off, Maxwell on his toes and gets over the top of the ball, square drives to deep cover
Ngidi to Carey, 1 run short of a length, worked off his hip through square leg
Ngidi to Maxwell, 1 wide a bouncer, angling over leg stump, climbs over his head
Ngidi to Maxwell, 1 run a short ball, perhaps doesn't bounce quite as he expected, a cramped pull to deep midwicket
Ngidi to Carey, no run angled into the pads, deflects towards backward square
Pretorius to Maxwell, no run 125kph, good length on off, pushed from the crease back to the bowler
Pretorius to Maxwell, 1 run 124kph, good length middle and off, he pushes a neat drive to long on
Pretorius to Carey, 1 run good length, 125kph, outside off, he's forward driving past point to the man at deep cover-point
Pretorius to Maxwell, 1 run 124kph, fuller on off, he drives off a thick edge that runs to a gap at forward square leg
Pretorius to Carey, no run 125kph good length, off stump, he defends on the front foot to cover
Pretorius to Carey, no run 126kph, good length, on off, he defends from the crease to cover
Ngidi to Maxwell, 2 runs 134kph, full driven nicely with the full face straight of mid on for an easy two
Ngidi to Maxwell, FOUR runs 136kph, short not that wide, but he controls a cut perfectly past point and it races to the rope! That was so well timed from Maxwell
Ngidi to Maxwell, 1 run 132kph, back of a length outside off, run with an open face off the back foot to third man
Ngidi to Carey, 1 wide slower ball pushed way down the leg side from around the wicket
Ngidi to Carey, 1 run 116kph slower ball, back of a length into the hip, he drops this close on the leg side and calls his partner through for one
Ngidi to Maxwell, 1 run 133kph, shorter length on leg, he tucks this down to fine leg
Ngidi to Carey, no run 135kph, full length, almost a yorker, squeezed out toward mid on but midwicket cuts it off
Pretorius to Maxwell, no run 127kph back of a length angled into leg, tucked to short fine on the circle

Pretorius to Maxwell, OUT edged and caught behind! Oh no! Just as he was looking in control, it was wide of off, not quite short enough to cut, he cut with the flashing blade, got a clear edge and de Kock took a simply catch! Maxwell admonishes himself.
Pretorius to Stoinis, no run 125kph, back of a length, off stump, he stands tall in defence
Pretorius to Stoinis, no run 126kph, back of a length outside off, he punches off the back foot straight to cover
Pretorius to Stoinis, 1 run 125kph, short into the hip, he's back and across and tucks behind square to the sweeper
Pretorius to Carey, 1 run 126kph, bouncer, he hooks with control, rolling the wrists forward of square to the sweeper at deep square
Steyn to Carey, no run 137kph good length on middle and defended
Steyn to Carey, 1 run 126kph, slower ball, outside off, he reaches for it, drags it square of midwicket for one
Steyn to Stoinis, no run 139kph, good length, off stump, he defends from the crease
Steyn to Stoinis, no run 144kph, full outside off, he check drives to cover
Steyn to Stoinis, no run 142kph, shorter length outside off, he's back and across and playing a textbook defensive stroke
Steyn to Stoinis, 1 run 142kph full outswinger, outside off, slices a drive through the vacant gully to the wide third man
Pretorius to Stoinis, no run 125kph, good length, top of off, he defends off the back foot

Pretorius to Stoinis, OUT caught at midwicket! This is a howling shot! From a length on off, out of nowhere he tried to launch this over mid on, dragged it off the inside half of the bat to midwicket and Hendricks held on to a superb catch above his head! It flew sharply and he clung on with one hand.
Pretorius to Cummins, no run good length, off stump, he defends off the back foot
Pretorius to Cummins, 1 run 123kph, angled into the hip, he tucks this away down to fine leg
Pretorius to Carey, no run good length angled in from around the wicket, catches the inside edge onto pad
Pretorius to Carey, 1 run 127kph, shorter length, angled into the stumps, he turns this with the angle behind square, they push for two but it's only one
Steyn to Carey, no run good length, middle and leg, he defends to midwicket on the front foot
Steyn to Carey, no run 142kph, inswinger to the left hander, he drives nicely but straight to mid off
Steyn to Carey, 1 run 143kph, full outside off, he drives to deep cover-point
Steyn to Cummins, 1 run 144kph full outswinger, he drives off a thick edge along the ground to third man
Steyn to Carey, 2 runs 145kph, edgeda drive off the bottom of the bat, bounces short of de Kock and he can't stop it, it runs away to fine third man
Steyn to Carey, no run 142kph, full outside off, he tries to drive but chops it back into the pitch
Pretorius to Cummins, 1 run 128kph, good length on off, he edges with an open blade along the ground to third man
Pretorius to Carey, no run 126kph short outside off, he is on the back foot knocking this away to backward point
Pretorius to Carey, 1 run 124kph back of a length, he runs this off the back foot to third man with control
Pretorius to Cummins, no run 126kph, good length off stump, defended to cover
Pretorius to Cummins, no run 128kph, full and straight, almost squeezes through, he jams off the inside edge onto pad
Pretorius to Cummins, no run 126kph good length, tailing into off, he opens the face and runs it to backward point
Steyn to Carey, no run 142kph, good length on off, he mistimes a drive dragging to midwicket
Steyn to Carey, 1 run 140kph, good length on off, he's forward running this with an open face to third man with the angled

Steyn to Cummins, OUT Bowled him at 145kph! Just a missile targeting off stump, it was cross seam, Cummins was a week late as it skidded through under the probing bat and crashed into off stump! Simply too quick from Steyn
Steyn to Starc, 1 run 145kph, back of a length outside off, he punches off the back foot to deep cover-point
Steyn to Carey, no run 144kph inswinger on off stump, he pushes on the front foot, slicing it to backward point
Steyn to Carey, no run 142kph, good length, on off, he defends on the front foot to point
Tahir to Starc, 1 run run out chance and Steyn missed! Pushed straight to Steyn ay cover-point and ran but the quick fired at the non strikers and missed
Tahir to Carey, no run turned straight to midwicket on the front foot
Tahir to Carey, no run pushed through, 92kph, he defends on the front foot to cover
Tahir to Carey, no run slower leg break outside of, he reaches out and defends into the leg side
Tahir to Carey, no run tossed up, yorker length, he drives but squeezes it back to the bowler
Tahir to Carey, 1 run control sweep with the spin, hit firmly to deep midwicket for a single
Steyn to Carey, 1 run 139kph, back of a length off stump line, he leans back an runs it off the face with a late cut to third man
Steyn to Starc, FOUR runs cracking square drive through point! This was full and wide and hammered on the front foot past point at the sweeper on the fence has no chance
Steyn to Starc, no run good length middle stump, defended into the leg side
Steyn to Starc, no run good length off stump, driven expansively and with power but straight to mid off

Steyn to Starc, OUT caught and bowled! Back of a length, he was cramped for room trying to turn this around behind square, closed the face too soon, got a leading edge and it lobbed up in the air straight back to the bowler who gleefully to an easy catch
Steyn to Zampa, no run 146kph, angled into middle and leg, he gets in behind it and pushes it to mid on
Tahir to Carey, 1 run full outside off, he sweeps along the ground to deep midwicket
Tahir to Zampa, no run wrong un first up, he picks it and defends on the front foot to cover
Tahir to Zampa, no run 93kph pushed through straight, defended to midwicket
Tahir to Zampa, no run wrong un, pitching outside off on a length, he drives extravagantly to cover
Tahir to Zampa, no run tickled down the leg side but de Kock couldn't catch it and it runs away. Barely a chance it deflected quite a way
Tahir to Zampa, 1 run tossed up leg break, he drives easily to long off who has gone back to allow Zampa to retain the strike
Steyn to Zampa, no run 145kph, short bumper outside off, he sways underneath it and lets go by to the keeper
Steyn to Zampa, 1 run 144kph shorter length and he pulls it well along the ground through forward square to the sweeper
Steyn to Carey, 1 run 137kph, full and wide, he drives hard straight to deep cover-point
Steyn to Zampa, 1 run 144kph, good length on off, he stays leg side and knocks it away to third man
Steyn to Carey, 1 run 140kph, full outside off, he square drives off balance a touch, but gets it to deep point
Steyn to Zampa, no run 140kph, short ball, tries to pull and is hit in the midsection! It doesn't affect him though. He rehearses the shot after missing out
Tahir to Carey, no run wrong un outside off, driven to backward point
Tahir to Carey, FOUR runs slog sweeps straight of deep midwicket and it goes one bounce over the rope! Great shot
Tahir to Carey, 1 run wrong un, bounces a touch, he knocks it close on the off side and pinches one
Tahir to Zampa, 1 run wrong un, slog swept in the air to deep midwicket and Steyn runs around to cut it off
Tahir to Carey, no run shorter on leg, he tucks this straight to midwicket
Tahir to Carey, FOUR runs driven inside out past cover and beats the man on the rope! That is a shot of the highest class against the turn, beating deep point who didn't have to run that far.
Rabada to Zampa, 1 run 134kph, good length off stump, he drives uppishly to deep cover-point

Rabada to Carey, OUT caught behind! Well bowled from Rabada. Shorter length, cross seam again, got a bit of extra bounce, he tried to run it to third man, got a thin edge through to de Kock and he takes the easy catch
Rabada to Hazlewood, 1 run 132kph, short ball, he leans back and upper cuts through the vacant gully to third man
Rabada to Zampa, no run 132kph, shorter length, he backs away and punches to point, Markram makes a diving stop
Rabada to Zampa, 2 runs 138kph, full he drives, chipping this high over mid off, just out of reach of du Plessis running back
Rabada to Zampa, no run 130kph, short bouncer, he sways under it and falls over backwards but gets out of the way as it flies through
Ngidi to Hazlewood, no run 131kph, short ball off stump line, he defends into the off side off the back foot
Ngidi to Hazlewood, FOUR runs short ball crunched to deep point and Steyn lets it go through his legs for four! It was a strong cut shot but he didn't get behind it and it went through his hands!
Ngidi to Hazlewood, 1 run short ball outside off, he mistimes into the off side, takes off, is sent back, the shy at the stumps misses and there is no one backing up, they get an overthrow
Ngidi to Zampa, FOUR runs lofted up and over cover! A bit of width, he clears the front leg and nails this over cover, good stroke and it races away
Ngidi to Zampa, FOUR runs flicked behind square! Brilliant from Zampa. Angled into leg stump and he whips this aggressively behind square and it flies to the rope
Ngidi to Zampa, 3 runs cut up and over backward point, it flies into the outfield and is saved just next to the rope by Klaasen, he doesn't touch the rope, they get three
Rabada to Zampa, 1 run 109kph slower ball, pushed through cover and it goes out to the sweeper
Rabada to Hazlewood, no run 136kph yorker angled wide of off, he misses it and it flies through to de Kock
Rabada to Hazlewood, no run beaten, 137kph, across him, he pushes and misses, it flies through
Rabada to Hazlewood, no run 131kph, bouncer, he sways back to try and upper cut but misses again and it flies to the keeper
Rabada to Hazlewood, no run 137kph, full on off, he pushes on the front foot to cover
Rabada to Hazlewood, no run short ball, chest high, the tall man sways inside the line and lets it go
Ngidi to Zampa, 2 runs 135kph, cracked off the back foot hard and straight of the sweeper at deep cover and they get a couple
Ngidi to Zampa, 1 run 136kph yorker, well dug out and it squeezes past backward point
Ngidi to Hazlewood, 2 runs full into leg stump, he flicks this up and over midwicket, nice stroke into the outfield for a couple
Ngidi to Hazlewood, 1 run upper cut to third man, it nearly carries to Tahir but he pulls out and lets it bounce just short! He could have dived at least.
Ngidi to Zampa, no run wide full toss outside off, he steps across and misses it, Zampa is frustrated
Ngidi to Zampa, no run 120kph slower ball, wide of off, outside the wide line, but Zampa stepped outside off to get to it, and missed. No wide call and rightly so given Zampa moved across
Rabada to Hazlewood, no run full toss, at off stump, he squirts this to backward point
Rabada to Hazlewood, 1 run 135kph, short into the hip, he tucks this behind square

Rabada to Zampa, OUT caught at midwicket! What a bizarre dismissal. It was a short ball at the body, he backed away and it followed him, he played a swat, tennis smash type shot and popped it straight up to midwicket. Easy catch for Miller.
Four wickets for Rabada and Australia ar bowled out with nine balls remaining.

Dwaine Pretorius has told the TV broadcaster that Australia probably got 10-15 runs more than they should have but the South Africans are pleased with their bowling performance. Australia had three players reach 40 but none reached 50. Rabada took four and Pretorius bowled very well to take 3 for 32. Chris Lynn tells the TV broadcaster they might
Innings break We will take a break and return in 40 minutes time for the run chase.
Starc to de Kock, no run full outside off, some late swing, pushed firmly into the covers from the front foot
Starc to de Kock, 1 run gets too straight, into the pads, worked to long leg
Starc to Hendricks, 1 run big appeal for lbw, a ripping inswining yorker, Hendricks just manages to keep it out. They don't review, and wisely too as it's comfortably missing leg
Starc to de Kock, 1 run a short ball, de Kock goes deep in the crease and nudges into square leg
Starc to Hendricks, no run full at the stumps, Hendricks hanging a touch leg side, this takes a leading edge into the covers
Starc to Hendricks, no run this zips off the surface, 152kph, back of a length outside off, left alone and Carey takes it above his head
Hazlewood to de Kock, no run back of a length at off stump, defended down by his feet and it bounces backwards
Hazlewood to de Kock, 1 run touch fuller, at middle and off, closes the face and works into square leg
Hazlewood to Hendricks, no run good length outside off, defended to cover
Hazlewood to Hendricks, no run nice delivery, back of a length outside off, hint of movement in as it's left alone
Hazlewood to Hendricks, 2 runs a short ball, he goes after it with a pull that is in the air, bit more top edge than middle, but easily clears the infield
Hazlewood to Hendricks, no run good length at off stump, 134kph, defended

Starc to de Kock, OUT picks out long leg! Starc strikes early, probably not how he planned. It's a length ball shaping into de Kock, he whipped it with his strong wrists, but never tried to keep it down and Zampa judged the catch well. Didn't go in entirely cleanly, but held on. Picked out the one man in the deep, a bit careless really
Starc to Markram, no run good length, angled across outside off, left alone
Starc to Markram, no run wider outside off, through to the keeper
Starc to Markram, no run goes for the fuller one, outside off, jabbed to the on side

Starc to Markram, FOUR runs edged, just wide of second slip! An uncertain prod outside off at a back-of-a-length delivery, healthy outside edge but Finch can't get there with a dive. Would have gone to third slip
Starc to Markram, no run full outside off, left alone...encouraging signs for Starc
Hazlewood to Hendricks, 3 runs that's a top shot, meets a full delivery with the full face and punches straight down the ground
Hazlewood to Markram, 1 run length ball pushed into the pads, worked into midwicket and just far enough from the fielder for a single
Hazlewood to Hendricks, no run full at off stump, driven to mid-off
Hazlewood to Hendricks, no run short of a length outside off, compactly played off the back foot
Hazlewood to Hendricks, no run fuller, outside off, doesn't get much timing in the drive
Hazlewood to Hendricks, no run full outside off, allows this one through to the keeper
Starc to Markram, no run pushed across wide outside off, left alone
Starc to Markram, 2 runs closer to off stump, full, driven into the covers
Starc to Markram, no run a well-directed short ball outside off, 148ph, he drops his hands and sways out of the line
Starc to Markram, no run back of a length at off stump, 151kph, good heat from Starc, defended to cover

Starc to Markram, SIX runs take that! That's one way to deal with Starc thunderbolts, this is fuller outside off, Markram picks it up off the front foot and deposits it over deep midwicket. Astonishing shot
Starc to Markram, no run no surprise that Starc follows it with a bouncer, Markram ducks and Starc manages a smile
Cummins to Hendricks, no run full at the stumps, defended to midwicket
Cummins to Hendricks, no run back of a length, gets inside the line and works into the leg side
Cummins to Hendricks, no run full at off stump, 138kph, defended to cover
Cummins to Hendricks, no run tucked from off stump into the leg side
Cummins to Hendricks, 3 runs gets on the pads this time, clipped behind square and the man in the deep is very wide
Cummins to Markram, 1 run well bowled, back of a length outside off, squares him up a touch and takes a thick outside edge to third man
Hazlewood to Markram, FOUR runs a little too straight, nicely timed off his pads and it runs behind square...fine leg is inside the circle
Hazlewood to Markram, no run back of a length outside off, punched into the covers
Hazlewood to Markram, 1 run on off stump, tucked into midwicket
Hazlewood to Hendricks, no run good-looking shot, the back foot drive pings off the middle, but finds cover
Hazlewood to Hendricks, 1 run short of a length, neatly inside the line and flicks it off his hip to deep square
Hazlewood to Markram, no run back of a length at off stump, 137kph, defended to the bowler

Cummins to Hendricks, 2 runs, OUT he's been run out coming back for a third! What an error from South Africa. Length delivery, clipped off the pads through midwicket, it was a comfortable two and they pushed for the third. Markram didn't seem to be putting in the hard yards, then brought out the dive but it couldn't save him. Bat may just h
Cummins to du Plessis, no run full at off stump, the captain defends his first ball to the off side
Cummins to du Plessis, no run back of a length outside off, left alone
Cummins to du Plessis, no run defended on the back foot to the bowler
Cummins to du Plessis, no run well bowled, good length at middle and off, defended
Cummins to du Plessis, 2 runs short of a length, on the pads, worked through square leg
Hazlewood to Klaasen, no run length ball outside off, nips back and defended to cover
Hazlewood to Klaasen, no run at off stump, 136kph, defended on the walk
Hazlewood to Klaasen, 1 run gets forward to a fuller delivery and drives behind square down to third man
Hazlewood to du Plessis, no run full outside off, defended
Hazlewood to du Plessis, no run full outside off, left alone. Good over from Hazlewood
Cummins to Klaasen, no run low full toss, 138kph, bunted back to the bowler
Cummins to Klaasen, 1 run comes forward and angles a length delivery down to third man
Cummins to du Plessis, 3 runs good shot by the captain, brings the bottom hand into play to take this from outside off straight of mid-on
Cummins to Klaasen, 1 run back of a length outside off, feet stuck in the crease and the ball squirts off a thick inside edge through the leg side
Cummins to du Plessis, no run short of a length on off stump, defended
Cummins to du Plessis, no run back of a length outside off, left alone
Zampa to Klaasen, FOUR runs starts with a big drag down, Klaasen is on the pull an places it wide of deep square
Zampa to Klaasen, FOUR runs another short one, this one is hit much better, taken through straight midwicket with power. Not a good start from Zampa
Zampa to Klaasen, no run gets this on a better length, defended
Zampa to Klaasen, 1 run touch short, outside off, cut to deep cover
Zampa to du Plessis, 1 run driven to the left of the bowler who can't cut it off
Zampa to Klaasen, 1 run tossed up fuller, driven down the ground to long-off. Expensive start for the leggie
Cummins to Klaasen, no run full at off stump, driven to mid-off
Cummins to Klaasen, no run full at the stumps, another one played towards mid-off
Cummins to Klaasen, 1 run a shorter delivery, angled into the hip, takes his bottom hand off the bat as he flicks it away
Cummins to du Plessis, 1 run a shorter delivery angling down the leg side, du Plessis gets over a pull and finds long leg
Cummins to Klaasen, no run back of a length, straight, defended to the on side
Cummins to Klaasen, no run 139kph, short of a length, defended into midwicket
Stoinis to du Plessis, no run short of a length, nudged into midwicket
Stoinis to du Plessis, no run banged in back of a length, defended on his toes
Stoinis to du Plessis, 1 run on his toes and punches off the back foot to the left of mid-off
Stoinis to Miller, no run back of a length at off stump, defended to cover
Stoinis to Miller, no run touch shorter, gets across to off stump and works back to the bowler
Cummins to du Plessis, no run back of a length, played into midwicket
Cummins to du Plessis, no run on off stump, 137kph, defended back to the bowler
Cummins to du Plessis, 1 run a shorter delivery at the ribs, knocked down into the square-leg area
Cummins to Miller, no run over the wicket, full outside off, defended to mid-off
Cummins to Miller, no run same spot, Miller walks into his defensive shot
Cummins to Miller, 1 run gets across inside the line and works off the hip behind square
Starc to Miller, 1 run full and straight, whipped off the stumps behind square
Starc to du Plessis, no run back of a length at off stump, jabbed towards point
Starc to du Plessis, no run gets away with this, full and wide, du Plessis reaches out a long way to drive and gets a bottom edge back past his stumps
Starc to du Plessis, 3 runs full at the stumps, squeezed wide of mid-on with a closed bat face
Starc to Miller, 1 wide that's a wayward one, pushed well down the leg side
Starc to Miller, 1 run full at off stump, pushed towards cover who allows it through for a freebie
Starc to du Plessis, no run length ball at the stumps, pushed to mid-on
Stoinis to Miller, no run 128kph, good length outside off, he's forward and defending solidly to cover
Stoinis to Miller, 1 run shorter length outside off, he plays an unusual stroke, he watches into onto the blade and runs it to third man from an awkward position
Stoinis to du Plessis, no run 131kph, good length, nipping back a touch, he stands up and punches to mid off
Stoinis to du Plessis, no run 128kph, short ball outside off, he's pulls but gets a thick bottom edge onto his thigh
Stoinis to du Plessis, 1 run nudges this to mid on and takes off for a tight one, Finch fires, Faf dives, Finch misses but Faf was well home
Stoinis to Miller, no run bouncer, well directed, he ducks underneath it
Starc to du Plessis, FOUR runs glorious cover drive! It was 147kph full outside off and he leaned into a superb drive on the up past cover and wide of mid off. Superb stroke
Starc to du Plessis, no run 125kph slower ball, on off, he defends on the front foot to mid off
Starc to du Plessis, FOUR runs cracking pull shot! This was a short ball at chest high and Faf jumped all over it, got in a great position and smoked a pull shot forward of square
Starc to du Plessis, 1 run another short ball, he pulls again but checks the shot with control and rolls it around to the sweeper behind square
Starc to Miller, 2 runs 147kph, into hip, he's jumping back and knocking this towards the square leg umpire and they pinch two. Super running
Starc to Miller, 1 wide 150kph but sprayed down the legside
Starc to Miller, 2 runs 147kph full toss tailing into leg, he clips this very fine, Cummins has to slide to save it at fine leg as they get a couple again
Stoinis to du Plessis, 1 run 128kph back of a length outside off, he waits an pushes this away through backward point for one
Stoinis to Miller, no run 128kph good length outside off, he defends with soft hands away to point
Stoinis to Miller, 1 run full and driven hard to the right of mid off and Finch makes an outstanding one handed diving save to prevent four
Stoinis to du Plessis, 1 run 131kph, angled into leg stump, clipped easily to deep backward square
Stoinis to Miller, no run he shuffles down the track, its 134kph, he jams it between bat and pad and it rolls away
Stoinis to Miller, no run short ball, he spots it early and sways under it
Zampa to du Plessis, no run tossed up on off, he defends on the front foot
Zampa to du Plessis, FOUR runs short drag down and he hammers a pull over midwicket! Another short ball punished. Zampa struggling to find his length
Zampa to du Plessis, 2 runs drifting down leg and he clips it past short fine leg on the front foot with control for a couple
Zampa to du Plessis, 1 run nice drifting leg break, full driven back past the bowler, he gets a hand on it but it flies away to long off
Zampa to Miller, no run leg break on middle, tucked straight to midwicket
Zampa to Miller, 1 run shorter leg break on leg stump, turned off the back foot through square leg
Stoinis to Miller, 1 run 130kph, full outside off, driven very nicely out to deep cover
Stoinis to du Plessis, 1 wide 125kph, pushed down the leg side
Stoinis to du Plessis, 1 run leg stump line, clipped easily to deep midwicket
Stoinis to Miller, 1 run 132kph back of a length, middle stump line he's back and working this to deep square leg
Stoinis to du Plessis, no run 134kph good length, on off, driven back to the bowler
Stoinis to du Plessis, no run 135kph, good length, top of off, he pushes to mid on from the crease
Stoinis to du Plessis, 1 run 132kph, good length, off stump, knocks it down to gully and they run a single, Miller has to stretch but he beats the shy from Maxwell
Zampa to du Plessis, no run tossed up, outside off, he's driven hard to cover but can't beat the man
Zampa to du Plessis, 1 run shorter length, on middle, punched off the back foot to long on
Zampa to Miller, 1 run full toss on leg, he drives along the ground to long on
Zampa to du Plessis, 1 run 95kph, pushed through on leg, he's back and tucked easily to deep square
Zampa to Miller, 1 run tossed up outside off, he stretches out and pushes through point for one
Zampa to du Plessis, 1 run tossed up outside off, very full, driven hard to deep cover-point
Stoinis to du Plessis, 1 run 131kph, outswinger wide of off, pushed on the front foot to the man in the deep at point
Stoinis to Miller, no run 135kph, good length outside off, he's forward but leaving this well wide of off
Stoinis to Miller, no run good length off stump, he's cramped defending on the front foot

Stoinis to Miller, FOUR runs short and wide and he cuts up and over point! A mistake given the field. He was trying to build pressure and dished up a freebie, Miller lifted the cut up and over the ring
Stoinis to Miller, no run good bumper, much tighter to off, he drops the hands underneath it and lets it go
Stoinis to Miller, 2 runs 137kph, good length but angled in and he tucks this from off, with the angle to the gap between fine leg and deep square and they run well
Hazlewood to du Plessis, no run 138kph, back of a length, wide of off, cut hard on the bounce but Maxwell makes an excellent one handed stop to save four
Hazlewood to du Plessis, 1 run good length, tighter to off, he props forward, waits and runs it off the angled blade to third man
Hazlewood to Miller, 1 run full on middle, he clips to mid on and takes a run, Head gathers and shies but Miller just beats the throw which misses at any rate
Hazlewood to du Plessis, 2 runs good length 137kph, outside off, he drives well on the rise forward of the point sweeper for an easy two
Hazlewood to du Plessis, 1 run short at the body, he swivels so quickly and pulls along the ground with control to deep backward square
Hazlewood to Miller, no run 138kph, short ball across him, he drops the hands and sways underneath it
Cummins to du Plessis, no run 136kph good length, off stump, he defends solidly on the front foot
Cummins to du Plessis, 1 run shorter length into the hip, he tucks this to square leg
Cummins to Miller, no run 136kph bouncer, well directed but again he ducks under easily
Cummins to Miller, no run 135kph, back of a length outside off, he defends with his hands away from his body to point
Cummins to Miller, no run 137kph bouncer again, even higher and outside off, he sways under it
Cummins to Miller, no run 139kph off stump, good length, he tries to turn to leg but can't get it past forward square
Hazlewood to du Plessis, 1 run top edge trying to pull but it flies high and safe way over the keepers head and down near the rope. It got a bit big on him that short ball. They got an easy two
Hazlewood to du Plessis, no run beaten outside off. Good length outside off, just nibbled away a touch, he tried to drive inside out but missed
Hazlewood to du Plessis, no run 140kph, fuller and closer to off, he defends on the front foot into the off side
Hazlewood to du Plessis, 2 runs short ball pulled brilliantly behind square and the man on the fence at deep square, Starc, had to make a superb diving save to prevent four
Hazlewood to du Plessis, no run 131kph half-volley but he mistimes the drive to mid off
Hazlewood to du Plessis, no run 136kph, good length, top of off, he defends on the front foot into the off side
Cummins to Miller, no run shorter length, pitching outside leg, taking him on the thigh and rolling away
Cummins to Miller, 1 run shorter length, middle stump, he tucks off the back foot around the corner to fine leg
Cummins to du Plessis, no run back of a length, top of off, he defends from the crease into the leg side
Cummins to du Plessis, no run 142kph, shorter length outside off, he's jumping back and across and defending to point
Cummins to du Plessis, no run 140kph, good length, top of middle, he defends again to midwicket
Cummins to du Plessis, 1 wide 137kph, short bouncer, he shaped to pull but bailed out, it was way too high and duly called wide
Cummins to du Plessis, no run 139kph, good length, well wide of off, he leaves this alone
Hazlewood to Miller, 1 run back of a length outside off, 138kph, he's back and forcing through cover-point to the sweeper
Hazlewood to du Plessis, no run 142kph, good length, fourth stump, defends with very soft hands under his eyes to backward point
Hazlewood to du Plessis, 1 run 137kph good length on leg stump, turns this easily behind square to the sweeper
Hazlewood to Miller, 1 run 141kph good length outside off, he runs this off the front foot to third man
Hazlewood to du Plessis, 1 run 139kph short ball, he cracks a pull shot hard on the bounce to deep square
Hazlewood to Miller, 1 wide 146kph, short down the leg side, he ducks and it's called a wide, Hazlewood not happy
Hazlewood to Miller, 1 wide 146kph way down leg, no arguments there
Hazlewood to Miller, FOUR runs supreme cover drive! This was full outside off and he plays a glorious drive, places it perfectly past cover and it races away to the rope
Cummins to du Plessis, 1 wide pushed way down leg again, another extra
Cummins to du Plessis, no run 138kph, good length, fifth stump line, he defends away from his body

Cummins to du Plessis, OUT chopped on! There's the breakthrough! This was back of a length and well wide, du Plessis threw the hands at it from the crease with an angled back, got a thick inside edge and dragged it back onto the stumps! A touch unlucky for the South Africa captain but Australia will take it
Cummins to Pretorius, no run good length, off stump, he defends on the front foot
Cummins to Pretorius, no run beaten outside off! Good length, nipping away, he spars at it and misses
Cummins to Pretorius, no run 142kph, wide of the crease, angled into off, he defends again on the front foot
Cummins to Pretorius, no run 138kph, speared into middle, full and he defends again back to the bowler
Starc to Miller, 1 run 145kph, into leg stump, he clips this past midwicket to the man in the deep
Starc to Pretorius, no run 145kph, good length on off, he defends on the front foot to cover-point
Starc to Pretorius, 3 runs 145kph driven nicely on the up wide of mid off and it beats the fielder and they get three
Starc to Miller, 1 wide 143kph bumper pushed down the leg side again
Starc to Miller, no run full inswinging yorker, huge appeal for LBW! Not out is the call. Australia don't review and wisely so. He got an inside edge and it was sliding. Ripping yorker though
Starc to Miller, no run another super yorker speared to off, and Miller jams down to keep it out
Starc to Miller, no run good length, off stump line, he plays a textbook forward defence to cover
Stoinis to Pretorius, no run 128kph, good length, off stump, he defends on the front foot
Stoinis to Pretorius, 1 run 130kph back of a length, outside off, pushed nicely past cover
Stoinis to Miller, 1 run 129kph back of a length outside off, he runs it off the open face to third man
Stoinis to Pretorius, no run 129kph, good length off stump line, he defends on the front foot
Stoinis to Pretorius, no run 127kph bouncer, that balloons high over the head but not called a wide, must have been just under head height given he ducked a touch
Stoinis to Pretorius, no run 132kph, good length off stump line, he forces from the crease to midwicket
Starc to Miller, no run 144kph, middle and off, worked with the angle to midwicket but can't beat the man
Starc to Miller, 1 run 142kph shorter outside off, he late cuts with control running it to third man
Starc to Pretorius, no run 145kph, good length outside off, he pushes firmly to cover
Starc to Pretorius, no run 145kph, good length well wide of off, he strides forward and lets it go
Starc to Pretorius, no run 143kph, short ball, lifted from a length, he propped forward and dropped the hands to let it whiz past his chest
Starc to Pretorius, no run 147kph searing yorker into off stump and he jams it out! He set the whole over up for it but the batsman read the play

Stoinis to Miller, SIX runs advances and launches over mid on! This was great batting. He shuffled down the track, no one back on the rope, he lofted the length ball up and over and it carried all the way
Stoinis to Miller, no run good length, outside off, he defends on the front foot
Stoinis to Miller, no run sloer ball, 110kph, outside off, driven hard but straight to cover
Stoinis to Miller, no run 129kph short ball outside off, he drops to a knee and sways under it
Stoinis to Miller, no run 131kph another short ball, again he drops low and sways underneath
Stoinis to Miller, no run back of a length outside off, pushed off the back foot to backward point
Zampa to Pretorius, no run starts with one dragged down but it's pulled to midwicket
Zampa to Pretorius, 1 run fuller and driven to deep cover
Zampa to Miller, no run full and straight, driven to mid-off
Zampa to Miller, no run clipped off his toes to square leg
Zampa to Miller, FOUR runs another short one, poor delivery, Miller has all the time in the world to rock back and place it backward of square with a pull
Zampa to Miller, 1 run gets a fuller length, clipped wide of midwicket to the sweeper
Stoinis to Miller, 1 run short outside off, drives to deep cover
Stoinis to Pretorius, no run full at off stump, clipped firmly down the pitch with the bottom hand coming through
Stoinis to Pretorius, no run full at the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
Stoinis to Pretorius, 1 run that's a medium-pace long hop (although they can take wickets) which is pulled powerfully to deep midwicket
Stoinis to Miller, no run round the wicket, short of a length, whipped to midwicket
Stoinis to Miller, no run outside off, left alone...not a million miles from off stump
Zampa to Pretorius, no run full at off stump, driven to cover
Zampa to Pretorius, 2 runs very full, he goes for the drive and it squeezes off the outside edge through short third man
Zampa to Pretorius, no run full, tossed up, played out to cover
Zampa to Pretorius, 1 run clipped through square leg
Zampa to Miller, 1 run uses his feet, almost yorks himself, drives to mid-off who is inside the circle
Zampa to Pretorius, 1 run leans forward and taps a straight delivery into the leg side...better over from Zampa, although South Africa don't need to take risks
Cummins to Pretorius, 1 run good length at off stump, he comes forward, takes the outside edge but safely down to third man
Cummins to Miller, 1 run back of a length on leg stump, tucked off the pads to deep square
Cummins to Pretorius, no run a short ball which Pretorius seems to make a late decision to try and ramp over the slips, ambitious shot and doesn't make contact
Cummins to Pretorius, no run pushes a back-of-a-length delivery to cover
Cummins to Pretorius, no run full at the stumps, pushed firmly to cover
Cummins to Pretorius, 1 run steered wide of point as he opens the face
Hazlewood to Pretorius, 2 runs excellent shot, gets forward to a full delivery and pushes it neatly straight down the ground
Hazlewood to Steyn, no run beaten first ball as he pushes away from his body at a back-of-a-length delivery
Hazlewood to Steyn, no run fuller, at off stump, drives to mid-off while taking the bottom hand off the bat
Hazlewood to Steyn, no run full again, driven square to point
Hazlewood to Steyn, no run a shorter delivery, Steyn just about stays in line as he defends on the back foot
Cummins to Miller, no run good length at off stump, defended to cover
Cummins to Miller, 2 runs short of a length on the hip, deflects very fine and Carey does well to intercept with a dive. Important runs saved
Cummins to Miller, no run that's a ripper from Cummins which climbs past Miller's outside edge
Cummins to Miller, 1 run punched off the back foot to deep cover
Cummins to Steyn, no run this jumps at Steyn from back of a length, takes the splice and pops to the on side
Cummins to Steyn, no run fuller at the stumps, defended to mid-on, so that's Cummins done for the night
Hazlewood to Miller, no run good length at middle and off, defended to cover
Hazlewood to Miller, no run a shorter ball, 139kph, Miller jumps back in his crease and plays to the leg side
Hazlewood to Miller, 1 run short outside off, nicely timed through point with a horizontal bat
Hazlewood to Steyn, no run short of a length, pushed to the off side...closing in on a run-a-ball needed
Hazlewood to Steyn, 1 wide a bouncer which angles down the leg side as Steyn ducks, and it's called wide to a few boos around the ground
Hazlewood to Steyn, 1 run a flashing shot from Steyn as he throws his hands at a short, wide delivery and flays it down to third man
Hazlewood to Miller, 1 run full outside off, good stride into the ball and drives to deep cover to take him to fifty off 68 balls. First half-century of the match
Stoinis to Miller, 1 run short of a length, on his toes and drives to deep cover
Stoinis to Steyn, no run works a straight delivery to mid-on with a bottom-handed flick
Stoinis to Steyn, 2 runs drives on the up over the off-side ring, wide of the cover sweeper
Stoinis to Rabada, no run length ball into the pads as Rabada tries to tuck it away
Stoinis to Rabada, 1 run gets the yorker in, Rabada gets his bat down and works it out to deep square leg
Zampa to Rabada, no run over the wicket, very full, in the block hole. Blocked.
Zampa to Rabada, no run touch more air this time, flicked to midwicket
Zampa to Rabada, no run good length, defended on the front foot
Zampa to Rabada, no run tossed up on middle and leg, pushed back to the bowler
Zampa to Rabada, 1 run this is a low full toss which is driven down to long-off
Zampa to Miller, no run a flatter, quicker ball skids on outside off and Miller is beaten over the top edge as he aims a square cut. Miller can't get the strike back
Stoinis to Rabada, no run a short ball over off stump, left alone
Stoinis to Rabada, 1 run round the wicket, full at the stumps, manages to get this past midwicket and wide of mid-on
Stoinis to Ngidi, 2 runs flayed through the covers, drives at a full delivery and beats mid-off
Stoinis to Ngidi, no run gives himself some and drives to room
Stoinis to Ngidi, no run backing away outside leg and flaps at a length ball
Zampa to Rabada, no run pads this away outside leg stump
Zampa to Rabada, 1 run full at the stumps, swung out to deep midwicket
Zampa to Ngidi, no run drives a length delivery back to the bowler
Zampa to Ngidi, 1 run lofted straight down the ground to long-on
Zampa to Rabada, 1 run plays forward and gets the outside to a googly, or maybe a slider, which runs through third man
Zampa to Ngidi, 1 run full at the stumps, clubbed down the ground...big effort from Zampa
Starc to Ngidi, no run round the wicket, full outside off, swing and a miss
Starc to Ngidi, no run same again, full outside off, Ngidi playing at fresh air
Starc to Ngidi, no run drives and misses at a length delivery
Starc to Ngidi, no run four in a row for Starc, fuller at off stump, Ngidi drives and is beaten
Starc to Ngidi, 1 run goes for the yorker, it's on target but squirts off the outside edge to third man
Starc to Rabada, 1 run full, angled into the pads, clipped down to long leg but just a single
Zampa to Rabada, 2 runs length ball, Rabada slog sweeps, doesn't connect that well and it goes wide of long-on
Zampa to Rabada, no run shorter, outside off, a googly and Rabada can't connect
Zampa to Rabada, 1 run full outside off, heaved down the ground to long-off

Zampa to Ngidi, no run is this a superb stumping?! Carey reckons so. A swing to the leg side, skids between bat and pads. Excellent take and whips the bails off...but it looks like he's just got the back foot over the line
Zampa to Ngidi, no run swing and a miss outside off
Zampa to Ngidi, FOUR runs tossed up, a low full toss, and it's slog-swept to deep midwicket. Does that keep South Africa just above alive?
Starc to Tahir, no run round the wicket, full and straight, driven to the off side
Starc to Tahir, no run full, wide outside off, plays over the top of it
Starc to Tahir, no run full at the stumps, Tahir well outside leg but manages to get the bat on it
Starc to Tahir, no run pushes into the covers and starts wandering down the pitch, but is sent back
Starc to Tahir, no run pushes a full delivery to the covers
Zampa to Ngidi, 1 run drags a low full toss from outside off to deep midwicket
Zampa to Tahir, 1 run full outside off, Tahir swings hard through the line and sends it to long-off
Zampa to Ngidi, no run heaves across the line, another good take from Carey as this bounces a bit
Zampa to Ngidi, 1 run swings across a length ball, takes a bottom edge to short fine leg
Zampa to Tahir, 1 run tossed up, Tahir heaves and gets a thick inside edge to the leg side
Zampa to Ngidi, SIX runs well, well...he connects over midwicket this time, given a bit of air, and it's sent into the stands
Maxwell to Tahir, FOUR runs round the wicket, it's a wide full toss, carved wide of short third man and goes to third man rope
Maxwell to Tahir, 1 run fired wide outside off, Tahir just about reaches it and jabs into the covers
Maxwell to Ngidi, 1 run full and straight, takes an inside edge past the stumps to short fine leg
Maxwell to Tahir, 1 bye wide outside off, huge swing from Tahir, he misses and it rebounds off Carey's gloves. Australia nearly home
Maxwell to Ngidi, 1 run the bat has flown miles! In fact, it has shaped the handle off, Ngidi loses his grip as he swings to the leg side
Maxwell to Tahir, FOUR runs carved through the off side, it will go to the boundary but Australia have done it
We'll wrap things up there for today. We are set for decider in Hobart on Sunday and we'll be back for that. For now, from Gnasher and Alex, it's goodbye and thanks for joining us.
Finch is also named Man of the Match for his runs and captaincy.
How significant is this for Australia? We'll see in the days and weeks to come, but it's something they were desperate for

Australia win by seven runs and the series is level at 1-1. The home side break a run of seven ODI defeats in a row. A superb performance in the field by them. The captaincy of Aaron Finch was very impressive. He backed his quick bowlers who delivered and Adam Zampa bounced back superbly as well. Has to be said it was a poor chase from South Afri
Australia won by 7 runs
Player of the match is Aaron Finch, AUS
